[BROFist Generic Data Types and Defines]

The structure containing BUFFER_SIZE BROFists to send to the SPAM. More...

#include <bro_fist.h>

Data Fields

uint16_t size
 Size of the combined BROFists.
bro_fist_t packets [BUFFER_SIZE]

Detailed Description

The structure containing BUFFER_SIZE BROFists to send to the SPAM.

This structure, as you can read below, contains also the dimension of the combined BUFFER_SIZE. This is needed by the ecrobot_read_bt_packet() function of the nxtOSEK system, since it requires the dimension of the packet to read from the BlueTooth buffer on the SPAM. A tricky way, really, that is not really needed, since that function requires both the buffer to write into AND the size of data to read. Really, it doesn't make much sense, but it works.

Field Documentation

uint16_t size

Size of the combined BROFists.

It is an uint16_t instead of an uint8_t since the aforementioned ecrobot_read_bt_packet() function requires the size of the packet to read to be 2 bytes large but only the first is used. Beats me if I know why is this way. However, another way to do this could have been 

uint8_t size;
uint8_t padding; // Padding byte. Not used for anything else.
